Reviews.Title: Its a great buy for your money
Reviews.Author: schorkb
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews for this product, and decided to try it for myself anyway...(2 and a half stars; REALLY PEOPLE???) Anyway, this is an amazing camera for a person who wants a simple point and shoot camera. I have read reviews exstensively on this product. Everyone should do their research when buying a camera that is less money. Most complaints I have read are people complaining about picture quality, light, video and handling problems. Let me start foremost by saying; picture quality. Many people complain about the quality of the pictures taken in odd lighting, or dark places such as in concerts...there is a menu on your camera that lets you choose between many different setting such as daytime and night! I have taken crisp, clear pictures in the dark, in odd lighting, and in places with flashing strobe lights! I've yet to have a grainy picture or odd light quality. Second, the video is pretty darn good for a camera that is now selling for only 100 dollars. Petty complaints like it won't zoom while filming with sound on is...well, just what I said; petty. Would someone want the sound of their zoom motors buzzing away in the middle of a video? No. Lastly, I'd like to address the complaint of the awkward handling. Yes, some buttons accidently get pushed and you need to get used to your equipment just like you get accostumed to handling a musical instrument. The lens cap is a bit iffy but it is meant for when you are not using or handling the camera (sitting on your desk, and you dont want dust on it). Also, I have read so many reviews (it makes me seriously ill), that say when they slide the compartment for batteries open, that the batteries fall out....okayyy....first of all, WHY ARE YOU HOLDING THE CAMERA UPSIDE DOWN WHEN YOU OPEN THE BATTERY COMPARTMENT?!?!? I mean, seriously??? It's called gravity, people. Olympus isnt responsible for making your batteries or battery compartment gravity-proof. My advice...before you use your camera, before you even TOUCH it, read your manual cover to cover....STUDY it. I don't care if you hate reading. Chances are, you are not going to take this camera out of the box and know every little thing about it. Also, don't make petty complaints over a $200 camera when you aren't able or willing to dish out 600-800 dollars for a top of the line model. Get real, people...

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: Given that this was designed as a point and shoot with a ultra long zoom, it is great value at well under $200.00.  This is not for those that want to do professional level photography.  This camera takes very nice pictures in decent light, gives you a great telephoto reach, allows ultra close up macro photography and is easy to use.  Certainly a great deal for the target audience.  If you like to just point and shoot, get nice pictures and want a long zoom, you should consider this camera.

Reviews.Title: Well worth it
Reviews.Author: Cheetah
Reviews.Content: For quite some time I've been looking for a camera that I thought would be impossible to find. I needed a good zoom, macro capabilities, panorama stitching in camera, good low light performance and good image quality. This little camera has all of the above. It's super easy to use, very intuitive, and also has "super macro" setting which lets you zoom in really close. The panorama mode takes a little practice, but I've been able to take a couple of good photos the first time I used the camera.I like the fact that ISO can be adjusted in many settings which gives you more control. I think it tends to produce slightly overexposed images, so ISO adjustment is a good option here. This camera does excellent in low light. I don't like using flash, and it performs great without it, without noise. And I personally like the fact that the flash does not pop up automatically in low light situations. You have to manually lift it out of its "nest".It also has its own small internal memory in case you forget your SD card, but most cameras have it nowadays.Yes, it's a point-and-shoot camera, and it's not ideal. Here are some things I am not as thrilled about.It uses 4 AA batteries. Needless to say, if you love taking a lot of pictures and unless you use rechargeable batteries, you will go through them quickly. Also, the slot for your SD cards and AA batteries are in the same compartment, which makes it really awkward. You have to hold it upside down so the batteries don't fall out while you trying to slide the door open and get/insert your SD card. Meanwhile, it's really easy to accidently push "ON" button, and your camera turns on, the lens extends forward, the lens cover falls off, etc. And all you were trying to do is to get/insert your SD card! So, it's kind of a painful process. They should have its own separate compartment for the SD card.And a minor flaw is the lens cover. It doesn't stay on the lens when you turn your camera on. Just sits there if you are holding your camera in a perfect horizontal position or slides off. So, I have to take the cover off first and then turn it on.So, there is it. Just depends on what you need in a camera and what you can live with.To me, it has all the features I wanted for a very modest price. And all the things I find less than perfect have to do with the ergonomics/design of the exterior, not image quality or camera features. And if you combine camera capabilities with photographer's capabilities, you can produce great photos. That's why I still gave it five stars.

Reviews.Title: High zoom for low budget
Reviews.Author: Ely Shemer
Reviews.Content: The Olympus SP-620UZ is the kind of camera you might buy if you're looking for a model with high zoom, but you don't have the budget for one of the expensive options available out there. It's certainly a model which you should consider buying, though you should keep in mind the fact that it's not a perfect model. The performances offered by this camera are quite good and it's a model that delivers plenty in return for the money you'll spend on it.It will look a bit like a DSLR, which is always a plus. As long as you consider it a compact which has a high zoom and you don't have huge expectations from it, it will do just fine.

Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this product and wish there were more deals like this. I didn't even have to read instructions. It was very easy to figure out. I bought this as a gift but decided to keep it for myself.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera for under $200 !
Reviews.Author: AmericanPatrick
Reviews.Content: I bought this on a link through Amazon as they had just run out. The link got me to Robert's Camera in Indy, they had 2 left at only a crazy low after Christmas price($120). Some of the reviews in here are way off the mark. If you want a perfect camera then move up in the dollar amount & stop complaining ! The market has hundreds of cameras that will do a better job from $399 to well past $3000. But for the money in this price range it can't be beat ! Ultra 21X zoom with all these features Olympus has everybody beat ! This camera serves me perfect. Works great for web uploads too. Read all the features this camera has and do a side-by-side comparison.... I did for a few hours and bought this 1. THIS IS NOT A POCKET CAMERA! It is a real camera. Please understand we have pocket cameras & bigger ones too but for a nice point & shoot+++ with ultra zoom, HD, and much more this model Olympus fits perfectly in between. Fantastic clear pictures & easy to use too....

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the money, terrible battery life
Reviews.Author: Audio_Aficionado
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great deal for the money and is a good compromise between the lower-quality point and shoots out there and an entry-level DSLR which can run several hundred dollars more.  I think it's worth mentioning that the major sticking point for me with this camera has been the abysmal battery life.  I've run through at least 10 sets (40 total) alkaline batteries in the year or so that I've owned this camera - with light to moderate usage.  I get maybe 100 pictures per set of batteries and then the camera will turn off when trying to take a picture or zoom.  And the thing is, the batteries themselves are still at maybe 75% charge - I can use them in flashlights, my work pager, or other cameras with no issue.  This camera just seems to have crazily high drain on batteries and will cause you to burn through many more fresh ones than any other device I've owned.  Still, a good value for the money.  I couldn't go below 4 stars just for the battery issue.

Reviews.Title: Takes great photo, Nice features, Nice zoom
Reviews.Author: Ontwain
Reviews.Content: This camera has a great feel and look to it, for a point and shoot, its pretty good. I find the features really handy especially the 'go to' feature in the help menu of the camera - if your not sure what settings to use for a certain pic, just use that function and the camera automatically adjust the setting for you. Its overall great, the zoom is really good, and give a clean shot even without a tripod (at times). Night images are as expected from a typical point and shoot in this price range. The only draw back that I have and its nothing major - and its probably due to me not finding it yet, is that I cant take monochrome pictures. But that's pretty much nothings really. great camera. If you follow the instructions you love it just as much.

I think this is worth the investment! I spent $300 on a Samsung and Im so much happier with this one!

Reviews.Title: beautiful
Reviews.Author: country wife
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera for my father to use who is visually impaired. I found this and could not be happier with it. The screen is large and shows an extremely clear picture that even he can appreciate. It is simple to use with relatively few buttons. Obviously bulky for a digital camera, but just what he was looking for in terms of having something larger to handle. It runs on  batteries which is more convenient than having to plug it in prior to use, and I purchased rechargeable sets for him to use. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a simple to use camera that takes fantastic photos!

And for the record, over the other reviews, you CAN zoom and record audio at the same time while recording video. Got it on time, love it to death. Recommended highly!

Reviews.Title: Gimmicky camera, lacking in quality, don't buy it!
Reviews.Author: Michelangelo
Reviews.Content: This model of Olympus bristles with palettes of software driven image modification "creativity" filters,which are O.K. if you're loaded high and trying to do some psychedelic takes of your messed-up bedroom,or if you are completely devoid of any ability to create interesting shot on your own without resortingto cheap gimmickry - then this would be certainly your prime choice.To add to list of "interesting" features I would be remiss not to mention this moron-designed lens cap,which will not stay on the lens while not in use, exposing the lens to possible damage. It seems that meregravity is able to overpower its "tenacious" grip of a lens barrel and launch it straight in the dirt, ifnot tethered, which is another highly annoying cockamamie "fix" of initial poor engineering.The performance of a zoom lens falls little short from the expectations, sometimes the lens is capable ofproducing "soft focus" - read BLURRY images. OVERALL - the camera is decidedly underwhelming, DON'T BUY IT!P.S. Olympus Corp. customer support really sucks too, so, if you need more headaches - highly recommended!
